biography: Mohamed Rela is an Indian surgeon and expert in liver transplantation and hepatopancreatobiliary (HPB) surgery. He is considered one of the world's best liver transplant surgeons. He is in the Guinness Book of Records for performing a liver transplant on a 5-day-old baby.

## 2. Medical Philosophy

Dr. Rela's medical philosophy is rooted in a patient-centered approach that prioritizes the well-being of each child and their family. He believes in fostering a collaborative relationship with his patients, ensuring that they are fully informed about their condition, treatment options, and potential risks and benefits. He understands that undergoing a liver transplant is a daunting experience for both the child and their family, and he strives to provide them with emotional support and guidance throughout the entire process.

His innovative thinking is evident in his approach to surgical techniques and post-transplant management. He is constantly seeking ways to improve outcomes and minimize complications. Dr. Rela is a strong advocate for evidence-based medicine, and he stays abreast of the latest research and advancements in the field. Ethical considerations are paramount in Dr. Rela's practice. He adheres to the highest standards of medical ethics, ensuring that his decisions are always in the best interests of his patients. He is committed to transparency and honesty, and he always provides patients and their families with complete and accurate information. ## 3. Key Procedures & Clinical Expertise

Dr. Rela's clinical expertise lies primarily in the complex and demanding field of pediatric liver transplantation. He is proficient in all aspects of the procedure, from pre-transplant evaluation and donor selection to surgical implantation and post-transplant management. His technical skills are exceptional, allowing him to perform intricate surgical maneuvers with precision and efficiency.

He is skilled in various liver transplantation techniques, including whole organ transplantation, reduced-size liver transplantation, and split liver transplantation. Whole organ transplantation involves transplanting an entire liver from a deceased donor into the recipient. Reduced-size liver transplantation involves transplanting a portion of a liver from a deceased or living donor into the recipient. Split liver transplantation involves dividing a deceased donor liver into two segments, which can then be transplanted into two different recipients. Dr. Rela's expertise in these techniques allows him to tailor the procedure to the specific needs of each patient.

His proficiency extends beyond the surgical aspects of liver transplantation. He is also highly skilled in managing the complex medical issues that can arise after transplantation, such as immunosuppression, rejection, and infections. He has a deep understanding of the pharmacology of immunosuppressant medications and is adept at adjusting dosages to optimize immunosuppression while minimizing side effects. He is also experienced in diagnosing and treating infections that can occur after transplantation, ensuring that his patients receive prompt and effective care.

Dr. Rela is particularly adept at managing children with complex medical conditions who require liver transplantation. He has extensive experience in treating children with biliary atresia, metabolic liver diseases, and liver tumors. He works closely with a multidisciplinary team of specialists, including hepatologists, surgeons, radiologists, and nurses, to provide comprehensive and coordinated care to his patients.
